intro: Tylomium assurgens, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil and indirect sunlight. Tylomium assurgens is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
